definition: a period of time/a while/for a short while/temporary/momentary/at the same time
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
all the rage for a time/grand fashion for a limited time
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
two remarkable persons living at the same period (as 周瑜[Zhou1 Yu2] and 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4])
variant of 轟動一時|轰动一时[hong1 dong4 yi1 shi2]
lit. at home, one can spend a thousand days in comfort, but spending a day away from home can be challenging (idiom)/fig. there's no place like home
pinyin: zai4 jia1 qian1 ri4 hao3 , chu1 men2 yi1 shi2 nan2
containing_words.word: 在家千日好，出门一时难

sentences.english: Also nobody proof, the child does not recognize the father, the county magistrate worried for a while.
sentences.chinese: 既没有人证明，孩子也不认爹，县官一时犯了难。

sentences.english: The rampant and absurd behavior that prince 2 for people unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 这猖獗而荒唐的行为叫马王二人一时措手不及。

sentences.english: Thus in this period, the subject concerning two-party system and party competes becomes hot point.
sentences.chinese: 因而这一时期有关两党制和党争的话题成为言论热点。

sentences.english: This adage says that even a clever person may do something stupidly.
sentences.chinese: 是说聪明人也有一时糊涂做错事的时候。

sentences.english: These developments culminated in the works of J. Bach and G. Handel .
sentences.chinese: 这一时期的种种进展在巴赫和亨德尔时达到了顶峰。

sentences.english: Remember that number puzzle craze a couple of years back?
sentences.chinese: 还记得风靡一时的数字拼图游戏吗？

sentences.english: Scientists say that working the body and mind at the same time revitalizes brain cells.
sentences.chinese: 科学家说，工作在同一时间，身体和精神赋活脑细胞。

sentences.english: On innovative spirits as a pearl in Zhenjiang history and culture;
sentences.chinese: 易中天以其独特的历史散文创作影响一时。

sentences.english: And in the same time, Hainan Special Economic Zone was established.
sentences.chinese: 海南经济特区成立于同一时间。

sentences.english: Copies of both notes were obtained by The Associated Press on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 所有备忘录的副本被美联社于周一时得到。

sentences.english: It's a time thing for the elephants.
Bigamy lightened the horizon of his shadowy thoughts for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 一时间，在他的思想中模模糊糊闪出了重婚这个念头。

sentences.english: Big time, like a wavelet than his previous high of the Line of Duty.
sentences.chinese: 上大一时，小波喜欢上了一个比他高一届的师姐。

sentences.english: Don't indulge in momentary pleasure but beg a pleasant journey.
sentences.chinese: 不逞一时之快，只求一路平安。

sentences.english: Parent-teacher conferences will be held this Saturday, October 22.
sentences.chinese: 家长教师恳亲会将于十月二十二日上午十一时举行。

sentences.english: Once famous, he is now a mere object of pity.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经名噪一时，但现在不过是一个让人怜悯的对象。

definition: a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
in the end/after all is said and done
hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
unexpectedly/actually/to go so far as to/indeed
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
